availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph F. Herd (Owsley County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Owsley County, Kentucky soldier. Kentucky native. Son of William Herd and Rebecca Hudson. Served in the 7th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as private and fourth corporal from September 22, 1861 to October 10, 1863. Served in to the 47th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as second lieutenant and captain from January 7, 1864 to December 26, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owsley County, Travellers Rest, p. 342A.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 468, 470.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0213.
